tn.text: Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You must keep ... you may live and multiply, and go in and possess ... your fathers
tn.text: All instances of "you" and "your" and the verbs are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is an idiom. AT: "You must remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"40 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"he might show you how weak and sinful you are"
"to reveal" or "to show"
The heart is a symbol of a person's character. AT: "what kind of people you are" or "how you would behave" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. He continues to remind them of what they should "call to mind" ([[:en:bible:notes:deu:08:01|8:2]]). (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"Yahweh showed you how weak and sinful you are." See how "he might humble you" is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:08:01|8:2]].
"gave you manna to eat"

tn.ref: it is not by bread alone that people live
tn.text: Here "bread" represents all food. AT: "food is not the only thing people need so they can live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: it is by everything that proceeds out of the mouth of Yahweh that people live
tn.text: Here "the mouth of Yahweh" is a metonym for the words that Yahweh says. AT: "people must obey the commands of Yahweh so they can live" or "people must do what Yahweh tells them to do so they can live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is the last item that they should "call to mind" ([[:en:bible:notes:deu:08:01|8:2]]).
"40 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: You will think ... You will keep ... walk in his ways and honor him
tn.text: This continues the list of commands that begins in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:08:01|8:1-2]].

tn.ref: You will think about in your heart
tn.text: Here the metonym "heart" represents the thoughts and understanding of a person. AT: "You will understand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"a land with" or "a land that has"
Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: a land in which you will eat bread without lack
tn.text: This litotes can be translated positively. AT: "a land where there will be plenty of food for you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

tn.ref: where you will not go without anything
tn.text: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "where you will have everything you need" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
The stones are full of iron ore. Iron is a very hard metal useful for swords and plows.
"mine copper." Copper is a soft metal useful for making household utensils.

tn.ref: You will eat and be full
tn.text: "You will have enough food to eat until you are full"
"you will praise" or "you will give thanks to"
Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"do not stop obeying his commandments" or "continue to obey his commandments"

tn.ref: when you eat and are full
tn.text: "when you have enough food to eat"

tn.ref: your heart will be lifted up
tn.text: Here "heart" represents the inner person. To become prideful and no longer obey Yahweh is spoken of as if the person's heart is lifted up. AT: "you will become prideful and no longer obey Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"your herds of cattle and flocks of sheep and goats"
"increase in number" or "become many"

tn.ref: all that you have is multiplied
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you have many more things" or "you have many more possessions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Here "heart" represents the inner person. To become prideful and no longer obey Yahweh is spoken of as if the person's heart is lifted up. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:08:11|8:12]]. AT: "you become prideful and no longer obey Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses begins to remind the Israelites of what they know about Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_distinguish]])

tn.ref: out of the house of bondage
tn.text: This is a metaphor for the time they were slaves in Egypt. AT: "out from the place where you were slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: who led you ... in the end
tn.text: Moses continues to remind the Israelites of what they know about Yahweh ([[:en:bible:notes:deu:08:13|8:14]]). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_distinguish]])

tn.ref: who led ... who brought ... He fed
tn.text: "Yahweh, who led ... Yahweh, who brought ... Yahweh fed"
"poisonous snakes"
This phrase describes the ground as being thirsty just like a person is thirsty when he needs water. AT: "dry ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"to help you" or "because it would be good for you"

tn.ref: but you may say in your heart
tn.text: This is the third thing the people might do when their hearts "become lifted up" and they "forget Yahweh" ([[:en:bible:notes:deu:08:13|8:14]]). Here "heart" is a metonym for a person's innermost thoughts. AT: "but you may think to yourself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: My power and the might of my hand acquired all this wealth
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to a man's power or ability. AT: "I got this wealth because I am so strong and powerful" or "I have acquired all these things by my own power and ability" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Moses continues to speak to the Israelites as if they are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: But you will call to mind
tn.text: This idiom is a command. AT: "But remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Possible meanings are 1) "in this way he establishes" or 2) "in this way he is faithful to establish."
"so he can"
"fulfill" or "keep"
"as he is doing now" or "as he is establishing his covenant now"
Walking is a metaphor for obeying. AT: "serve other gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: against you ... you will ... before you ... you perish ... you would not ... your God
tn.text: All these instances of "you" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"I warn you" or "I tell you in front of witnesses"
"you will certainly die"
"in front of you"

tn.ref: would not listen to the voice of Yahweh
tn.text: Here "the voice of Yahweh" means what Yahweh tells his people to do. AT: "would not obey Yahweh's commandments" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
